description:
Variation of conditions 2 (approved plans) attached to planning permission 2017/1193 dated 18/07/2017 [erection of four-storey building to contain youth club floorspace (Sui Generis) and nine residential units (C3 Use Class)].
The effect of the variation would be to relocate balconies from rear of building to the Cecilia Road elevation, extend the building envelope to include the previous balconies, make minor internal alterations to the basement and ground floor including adjustments to access, internal stairs, waste/service areas and cycle parking and install a lift.
decision_conditions: <p>The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.</p>

<p>Before commencement of the relevant part of the development, a 'Scheme of Highway Improvement Works' necessary to serve this development shall be submitted to, and approved by, the Local Planning Authority in writing. This shall address but is not limited to, removal and or relocation of street furniture and signage, reinstatement and improvement of footway, street trees etc. Any necessary payments associated with these works shall be made by the applicant to the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety and to ensure the development is well integrated with its surroundings.</p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved, a suitably detailed Air Quality Assessment shall be submitted to, and agreed in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be occupied until the recommendations of the approved Air Quality Assessment have been implemented. The Air Quality Assessment shall address how the proposal will impact on local air quality and detail of measures to protect the internal air quality, including:&nbsp;</span></p><p><br></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">a) Identifying how the building works and related activities as well as the future operation and use of the development may impact upon local air quality.&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">b) Modelling the impact of the development on local air quality.&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">c) Identifying mitigation measures that are already part of any planned development.&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">d) Identifying possible additional mitigation measures that may be implemented to maintain and where possible improve air quality in the vicinity of the development.&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">e) Providing full details of measures that will be implemented to maintain and where possible improve air quality in the vicinity of the development.&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">f) Providing full details of measures that will be implemented to protect the internal air quality of buildings.&nbsp;</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">g) Identifying measures that will be implemented or continue to be implemented after the completion of the development with clear timescales of when information will be provided.&nbsp;</span></p><p><br></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To protect air quality and human health by ensuring that the production of air.</span></p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved, a scheme to secure the occupation of the building as a car-free development shall be submitted to, and agreed in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall make explicit that all occupiers of the development (not being holders of a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to Section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 or similar legislation) including all such future occupiers, shall not apply for, or hold, an on-street parking permit to park a vehicle on the public highway at any time within the administrative district of the Local Planning Authority. Any permit that is issued to or held by any occupant of the development shall immediately be surrendered to the Local Planning Authority. The restrictions and requirements of the scheme shall apply to and be communicated to all future occupiers of the development, including successors in title, as well as any person occupying the premises as a tenant or licensee. The scheme shall be in in place prior to the first occupation of the development and retained in force thereafter.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To avoid cumulative impacts and further pressure on car parking supply and demand in a location that is within a Controlled Parking Zone.</p>

<p>No external shuttering shall be installed to the ground floor elevations of the building, unless shown on the plans hereby approved.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and appearance of the area.</p>

<p>No panelised brick slip systems requiring vertical or horizontal expansion joints shall be used on any of the building façades.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and appearance of the area.&nbsp;</p>

<p>All non-Combined Heat and Power space and hot water fossil fuel (or equivalent hydrocarbon based fuel) boilers associated with the development must achieve dry NOx emission levels equivalent to or less than 40 mg/kWh.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To protect air quality and human health by ensuring that the production of air pollutants are kept to a minimum during the lifetime of the development. </p>

<p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall be fixed to the (street) elevations of the building other than as shown on the drawings hereby approved.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.&nbsp;</p>

<p>The ground floor level external amenity area hereby permitted shall only be occupied/used between the hours of 08:00 to 22:00 on any day. </p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the use is operated in a satisfactory manner and does not unduly disturb adjoining occupiers or prejudice local amenity generally.</p>

<p>Before residential or non-residential occupation of the development hereby permitted, twenty-six (26) secure, accessible and sheltered internal cycle parking spaces shall be installed within the building (a minimum of 18 in the residential lobby) and four (4) secure, accessible and sheltered external cycle parking spaces shall be installed outside the building adjacent to the Dalston Lane access, in accordance with the approved plans. The cycle parking spaces shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that reasonable and permanent provision is made within the site for the parking of a cycle in the interest of relieving congestion in surrounding streets and improving highway conditions in general.</p>

<p>The playing of amplified or live music within the ground floor level external amenity area hereby permitted is prohibited at all times, and within rooms adjoining the courtyard prohibited between the hours of 20:00 and 08:00 on any day.&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the use is operated in a satisfactory manner and does not unduly disturb adjoining occupiers or prejudice local amenity generally.</p>
